com.solacesystems.jcsmp

Class ConsumerFlowProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.solacesystems.jcsmp.ConsumerFlowProperties

  • public class ConsumerFlowProperties
extends Object
    Properties for binding a consumer flow, used in JCSMPSession.createFlow(XMLMessageListener, ConsumerFlowProperties).

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new instance of ConsumerFlowProperties.

      • getNewSubscription

        public Subscription getNewSubscription()
        If binding to a TopicEndpoint, the subscription to set on the Endpoint.
        Returns:
        The subscription to set on the Topic Endpoint.

      • setNewSubscription

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setNewSubscription(Subscription newSubscription)
        If binding to a TopicEndpoint, the Topic to set/replace as a topic subscription on the endpoint. This must be specified for a TopicEndpoint, null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        newSubscription - The subscription to set.

      • getSelector

        public String getSelector()
        Gets the message selector, if one is set.
        Returns:
        The message selector.

      • setSelector

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setSelector(String selector)
        A SQL-92 selector to use for selection of messages for delivery.
        Parameters:
        selector - The selector to use on this flow.

      • isStartState

        public boolean isStartState()
        Checks whether a newly created flow should be in the started state upon creation.
        Returns:
        The value of the startState property.

      • setStartState

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setStartState(boolean startState)
        Controls whether a newly created flow should be in the started state upon creation. The default is false: new message flows are created in the stopped state.
        Parameters:
        startState - Whether a newly created flow based on these properties should be started automatically.

      • setAckMode

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setAckMode(String ackMode)
        Indicates whether the acknowledgement of receiving a message is done by JCSMP automatically or by the application explicitly calling XMLMessage.ackMessage(). Default: null (inherit from session).

        Allowed values are:

        • JCSMPProperties.SUPPORTED_MESSAGE_ACK_AUTO
        • JCSMPProperties.SUPPORTED_MESSAGE_ACK_CLIENT

        If message acknowledgement mode for the flow is SUPPORTED_MESSAGE_ACK_AUTO (the default behaviour), the call to XMLMessage.ackMessage() is ignored and a warning log is generated.

        Parameters:
        ackMode - The acknowledgement mode to use.

      • getAckMode

        public String getAckMode()
        Gets the flow's acknowledgement mode.
        Returns:
        The Message acknowledgement mode.
        See Also:
        setAckMode(String)

      • getTransportWindowSize

        public int getTransportWindowSize()
        Returns the Guaranteed message transport window size for the flow.
        See Also:
        setTransportWindowSize(int)

      • setTransportWindowSize

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setTransportWindowSize(int winSz)
        Sets the Guaranteed message transport window size for the flow. Valid values are 1-255. Default: 0 (inherit from session).

        If the transport window size is set to N, the maximum number of messages that can be in transit (that is, the messages are sent from the appliance, but are not yet delivered to the application) is N+1.

        Parameters:
        winSz - The Guaranteed message window size.

      • getAckTimerInMsecs

        public int getAckTimerInMsecs()
        Gets the flow's acknowledgement timer value (in milliseconds).
        See Also:
        setAckTimerInMsecs(int)

      • setAckTimerInMsecs

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setAckTimerInMsecs(int ackTimerInMsecs)
        Sets the acknowledgement timer for the flow (in milliseconds). Default: 0 (inherit from session).

        The valid range is 20-1500.

        Parameters:
        ackTimerInMsecs - The flow message acknowledgement timer.

      • getAckThreshold

        public int getAckThreshold()
        Gets the flow's acknowledgement threshold.
        See Also:
        setAckThreshold(int)

      • setAckThreshold

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setAckThreshold(int ackThreshold)
        Sets threshold for sending an acknowledgement, as a percentage of window size. The valid range is 1-75. Default: 0 (inherit from session).
        Parameters:
        ackThreshold - Acknowledgement threshold

      • isNoLocal

        public boolean isNoLocal()
        Gets the flow's noLocal setting.
        Returns:
        The flow's noLocal setting.
        See Also:
        setNoLocal(boolean)

      • setNoLocal

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setNoLocal(boolean noLocal)
        When the flow has the noLocal flag enabled, messages published on the session cannot appear in a flow created in the same session, even if the endpoint contains a subscription that matches the published message.

        The appliance that the session connects to must have the No Local capability, and the capability must be must be enabled.

        Default: false.

        Parameters:
        noLocal - Whether to set the NoLocal option on this flow.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException - If this option is requested, but the peer does not support CapabilityType.NO_LOCAL.

      • isActiveFlowIndication

        public boolean isActiveFlowIndication()
        Gets the flow's active flow indication state.
        Returns:
        the flow's active flow indication state.

      • setActiveFlowIndication

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setActiveFlowIndication(boolean activeFlowIndication)
        Applications that require a separate message for active or inactive flow indication must set this property to true when creating the flow.

        If the underlying session capabilities indicate that the appliance does not support active flow indication (CapabilityType.ACTIVE_FLOW_INDICATION), then JCSMPSession.createFlow(XMLMessageListener, ConsumerFlowProperties) will fail immediately and throw a InvalidOperationException.

        Default: false

        Parameters:
        activeFlowIndication - parameter

      • getConsumerNotificationDispatcherFactory

      • getWindowedAckMaxSize

        public int getWindowedAckMaxSize()

      • setReplayStartLocation

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setReplayStartLocation(ReplayStartLocation startLocation)
        This property specifies a message replay start location. If the underlying session capabilities indicate that the appliance does not support message replay (see CapabilityType.MESSAGE_REPLAY) then JCSMPSession.createFlow(...) will fail immediately with InvalidOperationException thrown.
        Parameters:
        startLocation, - replay start location

      • getReplayStartLocation

        public ReplayStartLocation getReplayStartLocation()
        Gets the message replay start location, or null if it is not set.
        Returns:
        replay start location.

      • getReconnectTries

        public int getReconnectTries()
        Gets number of times to attempt to reconnect to an endpoint after the initial bound flow goes down.
        Returns:
        number of reconnect attempts.

      • setReconnectTries

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setReconnectTries(int count)
        This property specifies the number of times to attempt to reconnect to an endpoint after the initial bound flow goes down. Valid values are >= -1. -1 means "retry forever". 0 means no automatic reconnection retries. The default value is -1.

      • getReconnectRetryIntervalInMsecs

        public int getReconnectRetryIntervalInMsecs()
        Gets how much time (in ms) to wait between each attempt to reconnect to an endpoint.
        Returns:
        How much time (in ms) to wait between each attempt

      • setReconnectRetryIntervalInMsecs

        public ConsumerFlowProperties setReconnectRetryIntervalInMsecs(int val)
        This property specifies how much time (in ms) to wait between each attempt to reconnect to an endpoint. Valid values are >= 50. The default value is 3000.
